topic.title: Power and Ground Interface

table.title: Device Power and Ground Pin Description

entry.p: See Normal Operating Voltages for AVS details.

Multiple fuse macros share the VDDQ. The AVS fuse macro shares VDDQ with two fuse macros that are controlled by the CAD fuse controller in the DIGI_M1_G5. The following table list the fuse macros connected to VDDQ.

li.p: Must be labelled as VSS in the HWS documents.
The maximum 1.8V exposure time is 0.2 second.

p.b: 0.8V Analog VDD for SERDES Bank A

entry.p: These power pins are for SERDES Bank A SA_RXI_P/N[23:0] and SA_TXO_P/N[23:0].
See Normal Operating Voltages for details.

p.b: 0.8V Analog VDD for SERDES Bank B

entry.p: These power pins are for SERDES Bank B SB_RXI_P/N[23:0] and SB_TXO_P/N[23:0].
See Normal Operating Voltages for details.

p.b: 0.8V Analog VDD for SERDES Bank C

entry.p: These power pins are for SERDES Bank C SC_RXI_P/N[23:0] and SC_TXO_P/N[23:0].
See Normal Operating Voltages for details.
See Normal Operating Voltages for details.
See Normal Operating Voltages for details.
See Normal Operating Voltages for details.
Multiple DCSUs are associated with each AVD_DCSU* pin.
DCSU_GRP1 - DSI, OPSA, OTN0, OTN1, SYS1, XDPI
See Normal Operating Voltages for details.

p.b: 1.8V Analog VDD for SERDES Bank A

entry.p: These power pins are for SERDES Bank A SA_RXI_P/N[23:0] and SA_TXO_P/N[23:0].
See Normal Operating Voltages for details.

p.b: 1.8V Analog VDD for SERDES Bank B

entry.p: These power pins are for SERDES Bank B SB_RXI_P/N[23:0] and SB_TXO_P/N[23:0].
See Normal Operating Voltages for details.

p.b: 1.8V Analog VDD for SERDES Bank C

entry.p: These power pins are for SERDES Bank C SC_RXI_P/N[23:0] and SC_TXO_P/N[23:0].
See Normal Operating Voltages for details.
See Normal Operating Voltages for details.
See Normal Operating Voltages for details.
See Normal Operating Voltages for details.
See Normal Operating Voltages for details.
See Normal Operating Voltages for details.
See Normal Operating Voltages for details.
Use of the device requires Adaptive Voltage Scaling (AVS). The device will assert the AVS_ENB output to indicate the correct voltage to apply.
When set to 0, the VDD digital core supply must be operated at a reduced voltage to meet datasheet power specifications for 0.79 V.
When set to 1, the digital supply must be operated at the nominal voltage of 0.82 V.
See Normal Operating Voltages for power supply details.
The device asserts the AVS_ENB output to indicate the correct voltage to apply (0.82 V or 0.79 V). The AVS_RSTB input controls the device logic that generates the AVS_ENB output.
See AVS Startup Sequence for functional timing.
Connected to the device substrate digital core supply. Can be used to compensate for the voltage drop between the regulator and the die.
Refer to Figure 1 on how the connection of VSENSE_0v8_BUMP is implemented in substrate.
Connected to the device substrate ground. Can be used to compensate for the voltage drop between the on-die ground and the regulator ground.
Refer to Figure 1 on how the connection of VSENSE_VSS_BUMP is implemented in substrate.
Used for power mesh integrity checks.
Refer to Figure 1 on how the connection of VSENSE_0V8 is implemented in substrate.
Used for power mesh integrity checks.
Refer to Figure 1 on how the connection of VSENSE_VSS is implemented in substrate.
Used as power probe ball for observing core digital power noise.
MSDG also recommended PE char board to select one additional pair of normal AVD and AVS balls close to the sense ball to allow comparison. See also PREPID 352141.
Refer to Figure 1 on how the connection of VDD_PROBE is implemented in substrate.
Used as ground probe ball for observing core digital power noise.
MSDG also recommended PE char board to select one additional pair of normal AVD and AVS balls close to the sense ball to allow comparison. See also PREPID 352141.
Refer to Figure 1 on how the connection of VDD_PROBE is implemented in substrate.
Used as power probe ball for observing analog digital power noise on the REFCLK channel and FracN analog domains.
MSDG also recommended PE char board to select one additional pair of normal AVD and AVS balls close to the sense ball to allow comparison. See also PREPID 352141.
Refer to Figure 1 on how the connection of VDD_PROBE is implemented in substrate.
Used as power probe ball for observing analog FracN VCO and CSU domain power noise of SERDES Bank A lanes associated to SA_RXI_P/N[23:0] and SA_TXO_P/N[23:0].
MSDG also recommended PE char board to select one additional pair of normal AVD and AVS balls close to the sense ball to allow comparison. See also PREPID 352141.
Refer to Figure 1 on how the connection of AVD_SA_CSU_0V8_PROBE and AVD_SA_VCO_0V8_PROBE is implemented in substrate.
Used as power probe ball for observing analog FracN VCO and CSU domain power noise of SERDES Bank B lanes associated to SB_RXI_P/N[23:0] and SB_TXO_P/N[23:0].
MSDG also recommended PE char board to select one additional pair of normal AVD and AVS balls close to the sense ball to allow comparison. See also PREPID 352141.
Refer to Figure 1 on how the connection of AVD_SB_CSU_0V8_PROBE and AVD_SB_VCO_0V8_PROBE is implemented in substrate.
Used as power probe ball for observing analog FracN VCO and CSU domain power noise of SERDES Bank C lanes associated to SC_RXI_P/N[23:0] and SC_TXO_P/N[23:0].
MSDG also recommended PE char board to select one additional pair of normal AVD and AVS balls close to the sense ball to allow comparison. See also PREPID 352141.
Refer to Figure 1 on how the connection of AVD_SC_CSU_0V8_PROBE and AVD_SC_VCO_0V8_PROBE is implemented in substrate.
Used as power probe ball for observing analog Credo IP domain power noise of SERDES Bank A lanes associated to SA_RXI_P/N[23:0] and SA_TXO_P/N[23:0].
MSDG also recommended PE char board to select one additional pair of normal AVD and AVS balls close to the sense ball to allow comparison. See also PREPID 352141.
Refer to Figure 1 on how the connection of AVD_SA_1V8_PROBE is implemented in substrate.
Used as power probe ball for observing analog Credo IP domain power noise of SERDES Bank B lanes associated to SB_RXI_P/N[23:0] and SB_TXO_P/N[23:0].
MSDG also recommended PE char board to select one additional pair of normal AVD and AVS balls close to the sense ball to allow comparison. See also PREPID 352141.
Refer to Figure 1 on how the connection of AVD_SB_1V8_PROBE is implemented in substrate.
Used as power probe ball for observing analog Credo IP domain power noise of SERDES Bank C lanes associated to SC_RXI_P/N[23:0] and SC_TXO_P/N[23:0].
MSDG also recommended PE char board to select one additional pair of normal AVD and AVS balls close to the sense ball to allow comparison. See also PREPID 352141.
Refer to Figure 1 on how the connection of AVD_SC_1V8_PROBE is implemented in substrate.
Used as power probe ball for observing analog Analog Bits domain power noise of the M10 SERDES lanes.
MSDG also recommended PE char board to select one additional pair of normal AVD and AVS balls close to the sense ball to allow comparison. See also PREPID 352141.
Refer to Figure 1 on how the connection of AVD_M10_IO_0V8_PROBE and AVD_M10_0V8_PROBE is implemented in substrate.

body.p: Please refer to PREPID 351141 for more detail on the discussion related to power sense and probe balls implementation. The diagram below shows the different connections types implemented.

table.title: Reference and Power Filtering Pin Description

entry.p: Connection for external bias resistor. Refer to the DIGI-G5 Hardware Design Guide (ESC-2170539) for required components and connections for these pins.
PLL reference input for external filtering. Refer to the DIGI-G5 Hardware Design Guide (ESC-2170539) for required components and connections for these pins.
